info.name: CheckBox
info.comment: The CheckBox class displays a checkbox widget in the UI.

description.p: The CheckBox class simplifies the creation and management of checkbox widgets in the user interface. Check boxes are simple widgets that are limited to exhibiting an on/off state. The CheckBox class allows for its graphics to be customised, so it is possible to redefine how the on/off states are displayed.
The standard mechanism for configuring a response to changing state in a CheckBox object is to set the Feedback field with a callback function.

action.name: Enable
action.comment: Turns the checkbox on if it has been disabled.

action.name: Focus
action.comment: Sets the focus on the checkbox and activates keyboard monitoring.

action.name: Hide
action.comment: Removes the checkbox from the display.

action.name: MoveToBack
action.comment: Moves the checkbox to the back of the display area.

action.name: MoveToFront
action.comment: Moves the checkbox to the front of the display area.

action.name: Redimension
action.comment: Changes the size and position of the checkbox.

action.name: Resize
action.comment: Alters the size of the checkbox.

field.name: Align
field.comment: Affects the alignment of the checkbox widget within its target surface.

description.p: By default the checkbox widget will be aligned to the top left of its target surface. The checkbox can be aligned to the right by setting the ALIGN_RIGHT flag.

field.name: Bottom
field.comment: The bottom coordinate of the checkbox (Y + Height).

description.p: The checkbox can be disabled on initialisation by setting this field to TRUE. If you need to disable the combobox after it has been activated, it is preferred that you use the Disable action.
To enable the combobox after it has been disabled, use the Enable action.

field.name: Feedback
field.comment: Provides instant feedback when a user interacts with the checkbox.

description.p: Set the Feedback field with a callback function in order to receive instant feedback when user interaction occurs. The function prototype is routine(*CheckBox, LONG State)

field.name: Height
field.comment: Defines the height of a checkbox.

description.p: A checkbox can be given a fixed or relative height by setting this field to the desired value. To set a relative height, use the FD_PERCENT flag when setting the field.

field.name: Label
field.comment: The label is a string displayed to the left of the input area.

description.p: A label can be drawn next to the input area by setting the Label field. The label should be a short, descriptive string of one or two words. It is common practice for the label to be followed with a colon character.

field.name: LabelWidth
field.comment: The fixed pixel width allocated for drawing the label string.

description.p: If a label is assigned to a checkbox, the width of the label will be calculated on initialisation and the value will be readable from this field. It is also possible to set the LabelWidth prior to initialisation, in which case the label string will be restricted to the space available.

field.name: Region
field.comment: The surface that represents the checkbox is referenced here.

description.p: The drawable area that represents the checkbox display can be accessed through this field. For further information, refer to the Surface class. Note that talking to the surface directly can have adverse effects on the checkbox control system. Where possible, all communication should be limited to the checkbox object itself.

field.name: Right
field.comment: The right coordinate of the checkbox (X + Width).

field.name: Surface
field.comment: The surface that will represent the checkbox widget.

description.p: The surface that will contain the checkbox widget is set here. If this field is not set prior to initialisation, the checkbox will attempt to scan for the correct surface by analysing its parents until it finds a suitable candidate.

field.name: TabFocus
field.comment: Set this field to a TabFocus object to register the checkbox in a tab-list.

description.p: The TabFocus field provides a convenient way of adding the checkbox to a TabFocus object, so that it can be focussed on via the tab key. Simply set this field to the ID of the TabFocus object that is managing the tab-list for the application window.

field.name: Value
field.comment: Indicates the current on/off state of the checkbox.

description.p: To get the on/off state of the checkbox, read this field. It can also be set at run-time to force the checkbox into an on or off state. Only values of 0 (off) and 1 (on) are valid.

field.name: Width
field.comment: Defines the width of a checkbox.

description.p: A checkbox can be given a fixed or relative width by setting this field to the desired value. To set a relative width, use the FD_PERCENT flag when setting the field.

field.name: X
field.comment: The horizontal position of a checkbox.

description.p: The horizontal position of a checkbox can be set to an absolute or relative coordinate by writing a value to the X field. To set a relative/percentage based value, you must use the FD_PERCENT flag or the value will be interpreted as fixed. Negative values are permitted.

field.name: XOffset
field.comment: The horizontal offset of a checkbox.

description.p: The XOffset has a dual purpose depending on whether or not it is set in conjunction with an X coordinate or a Width based field.

If set in conjunction with an X coordinate then the checkbox will be drawn from that X coordinate up to the width of the container, minus the value given in the XOffset. This means that the width of the CheckBox is dynamically calculated in relation to the width of the container.
If the XOffset field is set in conjunction with a fixed or relative width then the checkbox will be drawn at an X coordinate calculated from the formula X = ContainerWidth - CheckBoxWidth - XOffset.

field.name: Y
field.comment: The vertical position of a checkbox.

description.p: The vertical position of a CheckBox can be set to an absolute or relative coordinate by writing a value to the Y field. To set a relative/percentage based value, you must use the FD_PERCENT flag or the value will be interpreted as fixed. Negative values are permitted.

field.name: YOffset
field.comment: The vertical offset of a checkbox.

description.p: The YOffset has a dual purpose depending on whether or not it is set in conjunction with a Y coordinate or a Height based field.

If set in conjunction with a Y coordinate then the checkbox will be drawn from that Y coordinate up to the height of the container, minus the value given in the YOffset. This means that the height of the checkbox is dynamically calculated in relation to the height of the container.

If the YOffset field is set in conjunction with a fixed or relative height then the checkbox will be drawn at a Y coordinate calculated from the formula Y = ContainerHeight - CheckBoxHeight - YOffset.

This flag applies to image resizing. When set, the calculated width and height will be limited so that the image cannot be stretched beyond the edges of the target surface. This flag is commonly set in conjunction with the 11RATIO flag.
Turns off alpha-blending if the target surface has the COMPOSITE flag set and the source image has an alpha channel.

Image data will normally be stored at its original size and resized on the fly when the STRETCH flag is used. Setting the FIXED_SIZE flag will pre-scale the image and permanently store it at that size.
This flag conveniently combines the ENLARGE and SHRINK flags to ensure that the image always covers the dimensions of the destination surface.
